title: cmd/internal: AVX2 instruction VPSHUFD failed to compile
body:
1. What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
1.7-beta2, 1.7-beta3

2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?
```
GOARCH="amd64"
GOBIN=""
GOEXE=""
GOHOSTARCH="amd64"
GOHOSTOS="linux"
GOOS="linux"
GORACE=""
CC="gcc"
GOGCCFLAGS="-fPIC -m64 -pthread -fmessage-length=0"
CXX="g++"
CGO_ENABLED="1"
```

What did you do?
The AVX2 instruction  `VPSHUFD $0x39, Y1, Y1` and `VPSHUFD $0x78, Y1, Y1`
compile, but `VPSHUFD $0x93, Y0, Y0` e.g. fails with: 
> asm: invalid instruction: 03087 VPSHUFD	$147, Y1, Y1  

If I use the plain byte representation,
in my case `BYTE $0xC5; BYTE $0xFD; BYTE $0x70; BYTE $0xC9; BYTE $0x93`
everything is fine...

For reproducing:
```
TEXT Â·foo(SB),4,$0-8
         VPSHUFD $0x39, Y1, Y1
         VPSHUFD $0x93, Y1, Y1
         RET
```
